image.altText: A jet plane taking off from a remote mine site in the outback.

props.synopsis: Mineral Resources is looking to take a 21-year lease at WA's Kambalda Airport, in a deal set to inject millions of dollars into the local council's coffers.

title.children: Billionaire miner seeks control of country town's airport as shuttle point for FIFO fleet

image.altText: A hand holding a pink vape

props.synopsis: WA says it won't allow vapes to be sold without a prescription, despite new federal regulations allowing it. Yet vapes are still easily obtainable illegally, and only two sellers have been prosecuted.

title.children: WA to toughen vape laws again — but only two shops have been prosecuted for illegal sales

image.altText: book ban council

props.synopsis: City of Albany councillors voted 8-3 not to remove sex education books Sex: A Book for Teens and not restrict access to the award-winning Welcome to Sex at its public library.

title.children: Albany councillors have rejected a proposed ban on sex education books from the local library. So where are they?

image.altText: A woman waist deep in a pool with a child swimming and two children sitting on the edge

props.synopsis: The state government announcement of free kids' summer swimming lessons led to a rush in enrolments and many parents are unhappy that their children will now miss out.

title.children: Kids' summer swimming lessons swiftly book out in WA after fees waived, prompting backlash

image.altText: a hand reaches for a red cup filled with beef jerky

props.synopsis: With a growing emphasis on healthy, protein-rich diets among families and households, consumers are turning to alternative approaches to snacking on the go.

title.children: Country shop clearing $10,000 worth of beef jerky a week as diet and consumer demands shift

image.altText: A dead cattle's skull resting against a tree, rusty lighting

props.synopsis: Allegations of animal welfare issues and financial mismanagement have plagued the Kimberley Meat Company in WA's north for nearly a decade. Now it has shut down owing more than $100 million.

title.children: 'Appalling': Local businesses out of pocket after abattoir shuts down owing $103 million

image.altText: A man with black hair and a long black beard in a shirt with glasses stands in front of buildings

props.synopsis: The death of a friend in jail by suicide prompted former inmate Kelvin Whitwell to become a counsellor on the outside. Now he's calling for WA's prison system to be reformed.

title.children: Former inmate calls for intervention to halt spiralling WA prison conditions

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks slightly cross while giving a press conference.

props.synopsis: Negative gearing and capital gains tax rules have sat in Labor's bottom drawer since the party's bruising 2019 election defeat. Now, with Labor's primary vote slipping in the polls, there's speculation they could be back on the table.

title.children: 'We'll run a scare campaign': Inside the politics surrounding Labor's negative gearing dilemma

image.altText: Smoke billows over a residential area

props.synopsis: Israel's military chief tells troops air strikes in Lebanon will continue in order to destroy Hezbollah infrastructure and to prepare the way for a possible ground operation by Israeli forces.

title.children: Air strikes on Lebanon a precursor to possible ground operations, Israeli military chief says

image.altText: A gas plant.

props.synopsis: Closing the nuclear-energy electricity gap with gas power will cost $70 billion, boost emissions by 325 million tonnes, and increase gas usage through to 2035 by five times annual production, according to new Labor analysis.

title.children: Dutton's plan for nuclear power will open up a $70 billion gas gap, Labor says

image.altText: A tank fires a large fiery blast in a field.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian Ambassador Vasyl Myroshnychenko says if Australia's older tanks were eventually donated his country "will put them good to use".

title.children: Fresh hope Ukraine will soon receive ageing Australian Abrams tanks as Defence reviews military support

image.altText: A horse buggy going past a fire.

props.synopsis: As the price of copper surges globally, armed criminal syndicates are stripping the country bare in search of easy cash.

title.children: 'It's fast cash': The hunt for a metal so lucrative that thieves risk electrocution to steal it is crippling South Africa

image.altText: cranes in beijing

props.synopsis: China has announced a broad suite of stimulus measures, but analysts are sceptical about whether they are enough to kickstart a sluggish economy.

title.children: 'Too little, too late': New China stimulus blitz faces scepticism from economists

image.altText: Williams wears black rimmed glasses at his home, looking outward to some greenery

props.synopsis: Kim Williams says the ABC is "eager to restore" a bureau in Beijing after the last correspondent was forced to leave in 2020.

title.children: ABC chair calls for return of China correspondent to mark 'profound' importance of Beijing on world stage

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: Basic grocery items are still cheaper at Aldi when compared with Coles and Woolworths, according to consumer group Choice, which has again found little price difference between the two major grocers.

title.children: Choice report finds cost of basket of goods at Coles and Woolworths is 'almost identical'

image.altText: Composite image - easey street

props.synopsis: A man says he won't fight extradition to Melbourne to face charges of murdering two women in 1977, sparking 'disbelief' from the family of one victim.

title.children: Lawyer for Easey Street accused Perry Kouroumblis says he will agree to extradition

image.altText: An older woman with blonde hair and a white blazer looks at the camera in a composite image with police officers

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers allegations of bullying, sexism and a dangerous lack of support within the ranks of NSW Police, which officers say is driving hundreds of officers out of the force.

title.children: Bullying, sexism and 'toxic' culture claims levelled at Australia's biggest police force

image.altText: A woman in yellow jumper holding shopping bag faces a supermarket shelf full of colourful wrapped foods.

props.synopsis: Many of us are looking to save money at the grocery shop, but it's not always that simple. Here are a few pointers that could make a difference.

title.children: Tips and tricks for shrinking your supermarket spending

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: That huge slowdown in the pace of headline inflation was expected, but economists say it needs to be interpreted cautiously.

title.children: Headline inflation drops to 2.7pc, down from 3.5pc, as energy rebates kick in

image.altText: Portraits of nine women looking serious are arranged in a grid.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women who won a landmark class action settlement more than a year ago over damage done by pelvic mesh have still not received any compensation.

title.children: More than a year after their $300 million settlement, these women have still not received any money

image.altText: Ben Hood speaks to a man watched on by a woman on the steps of parliament house

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 people have turned up at the steps of South Australia's Parliament House in support of a proposal to change state abortion laws.

title.children: Hundreds rally in support of proposed changes to SA's abortion laws

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The policy that just won't quit is back. Will Labor revisit its 2016 and 2019 election policies?

title.children: We're talking about negative gearing again, but why is it such a big deal?

image.altText: Liz Watson and Sophie Garbin celebrate Australia's win over England.

props.synopsis: With the series on the line, the world champion Diamonds rebound from their second-Test loss to triumph 69-56 against the Roses in Bendigo.

title.children: Australia claims series honours against England with clinical victory in final Test

image.altText: Bella Eddey pumps her right fist during North Melbourne's win over Carlton.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne kicks the first nine goals of the match on its way to a convincing 69-point win over Carlton at Princes Park.

title.children: Kangaroos crush Blues in record win to claim top spot on AFLW ladder

image.altText: An electric vehicle by Geely is seen displayed at a car showroom.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is in contact with the US about the new moves it has put up against Chinese car companies.

title.children: The US government is effectively banning Chinese-made cars from its roads. Some in Australia want the government to take notice

image.altText: A fire can be seen burning in the distance, with smoke filling the air above.

props.synopsis: The blaze broke out this afternoon at a commercial building on Woolloongabba's Hubert Street.

title.children: Man in hospital with life-threatening injuries as fire burns in Brisbane's inner south-east

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses, standing in front of a wall full of old photographs

props.synopsis: Richard "Dick" Caine was charged with 39 offences committed against six teenagers at the pool and in his home and car in the 1970s and '80s. A court previously heard he had terminal lung and throat cancer and was expected to have only months to live.

title.children: Sydney swim coach dies weeks after being found guilty of raping and sexually assaulting young girls

image.altText: Two seconds of CCTV footage showing a woman moving a smartphone towards a man's face.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Kikkert was disendorsed by the Liberals two weeks ago over allegations about donations and behaviour towards staff.

title.children: 'Lowest political game': Former Canberra Liberals MLA Elizabeth Kikkert defends actions after CCTV clip released

image.altText: Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto, pictured outside the Federal Court in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal Party leader John Pesutto admits under cross-examination that he shared names with Jeff Kennett of party members who supported expelled MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: Pesutto shared defamation case settlement details with former Liberal premier Jeff Kennett, trial hears

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a goal as Nick Blakey looks on

props.synopsis: Joe Daniher will have a major say on whether Brisbane can claim its first premiership since 2004 when he lines up in the grand final on Saturday. It is a role he came very close to playing for the Lions's grand final opponents, Sydney.

title.children: How Brisbane's potential grand final gamebreaker Joe Daniher slipped out of Sydney's grasp twice

image.altText: A man holding a rifle with a woman in sunglasses beside him.

props.synopsis: The investigation found the Secret Service and other security agencies had no plan for coverage of the building where the shooter climbed up to fire the shots.

title.children: Senate investigation finds attempted assassination against Donald Trump was 'preventable'

image.altText: Joe Biden stands in front of a green wall and holds up a hand.

props.synopsis: World leaders are gathering in New York this week with a growing list of conflicts and crises to discuss. Here are some takeaways from the first day of debate at the UN General Assembly.

title.children: Global leaders gather at the UN as world's top diplomat says Middle-East is edging towards full-scale war

image.altText: A shot of downtown Whitesburg shows red brick buildings and cars lining a street

props.synopsis: A small US town has been rocked after a district court judge was shot and killed in his chambers. A sheriff and long-time colleague has been charged with his murder.

title.children: The case of a sheriff accused of murdering a judge in his chambers is captivating Americans

image.altText: Australian Made logos.

props.synopsis: It is an iconic Australian logo, but a coalition of businesses want Aussie-made logos to be made clearer after a survey finds more than half of consumers are being misled into buying foreign-owned products.

title.children: Is the kangaroo label confusing? Locally owned businesses call for clearer Australian Made labelling

image.altText: Women in dresses standing and one lady sitting on the floor

props.synopsis: The Netflix-inspired event is drawing comparisons to the infamous Willy Wonka experience fiasco earlier this year.

title.children: Bridgerton fans paid hundreds of dollars for a themed ball in Detroit. Here's why they weren't impressed
